bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Paul V. Collins to Laura Armistead Carter, August 28, 1925

div1.p: Collins thanks Carter for her assistance on an article he has written about mosquitoes and encloses a copy of the article.

div1.head: Letter from Paul V. Collins to Laura Armistead Carter, August 28, 1925
div1.opener:
Keynotes
By
Paul V. Collins
Copyrighted 1921 [unclear] By P.V. Collins
DAILY EDITORIALS ON NATIONAL ISSUES
THE PAUL V. COLLINS EDITORIAL SYNDICATE
2016 PIERCE MILL ROAD
WASHINGTON, D.C.
TELEPHONE ADAMS 440
August 28, 1925
Miss Laura A. Carter
City
Dear Miss Carter,
div1.p:
Appreciating your tip in connection with
my mosquito hunt, I enclose a clipping of the article. I hope
you will always be as successful in escaping from skeeters and
tigers as you were in Panama.

I am very sorry to learn of your father's serious
illness and wish I could be of service in your stress. I can
only express my sincere sympathy.
div1.closer:
Yours sincerely Paul V. Collins “And there's so much I do not know!
There's knowledge in the
printed page.”
